adjective.description: Clear or obvious to the eye or mind.

verb.description: Display or show (a quality or feeling) by one's acts or appearance; demonstrate.
examples: Ray manifested signs of severe depression

noun.description: A document giving comprehensive details of a ship and its cargo and other contents, passengers, and crew for the use of customs officers.

origin: Mid 16th century (denoting a manifestation): from Italian manifesto (see manifesto). The current sense dates from the early 17th century.
